5wFx3SigdAHTtOUKo7YQ-Q.text: This place is cool. The atmosphere is fun and contemporary and feels great. There is no patio for smokers or those who want to eat outside.     On a great note the sushi rolls are very creative and by far the coolest selection I've seen. Also, they are made well and taste great.     On a downside the restaurant is a little expensive, but I've never been able to come in during their happy hour. Also, the service is bad. I can never really get a straight answer about things on the menu and I never feel like the waitresses care about my being there and helping pay their salary.     Other than the spotty service and the high prices this place is fun and would be a good "date night" for many couples.

FMIFRFGc4QQgTDvFrcdN8A.text: went to eat there last year for my birthday. LOVED the food and the atmosphere was great. My fiance loved the egg rolls.

xsszwwmnlPs86OnglsdPcg.text: The sushi here is really really good, and the reverse happy hour is so great! However, the bartender is the worst! She has ignored me every time I've been there...I kept hoping it would get better but it only got worse. You will sit there for at least 15 minutes before she will bother to come over. One time my fiance asked her for a beer as she walked by and she said "just a minute" extremely sarcastically to him. We have seriously sat there every time we have been there and watched her flirt with some guys at the bar while we just sat there needing service. Also, she's pretty vulgar too, several f bombs have been dropped. Do not bring your parents to the bar!! I can guarantee she has never been a bartender before. I am really hoping management gets a clue and cans her ASAP so we can not leave that place angry next time. I wish I could say I won't go back but the sush is so good that we may just avoid the bar area, plus it's literally down the road.

Ty6eje1boVBhMZOkF3wAUg.text: My absolute favorite sushi joint in the valley!   The albacore is prepared the best and is by far the most tasty!! Their Happy Hour is to die for as well!! If you like sushi and are in Mesa/ Tempe..DEFF give this place a try!!!

EH5r5vvF0jxbekyLgWFTSw.text: We love saketini sushi! Its open late, and has a nice atmosphere. The rolls are unique and flavorful.

5fxOpO5h9NP9c_LO7XaGwQ.text: After reading some of the not so stellar reviews, I was a bit apprehensive about eating here. When my party arrived we were promptly sat and drink orders were taken. We then looked over the huge sushi menu. They have pictures of every single roll they have, which makes it so much easier to order. All of the rolls I ordered were simply amazing! I had spicy tuna, might have been one of the best spicy tuna rolls I have ever had. Also had the Vegas roll...holy hell... Once again.. One of the best Vegas rolls I have ever had. The waitress comped one of my adult libations because she could tell I wasn't a fan of the drink and brought me a new one. Overall the service was amazing and so was the sushi. I hope people read this review and know this place is legit.

pLBOLD_W_wEPAIJlzriV3A.text: Disappointing to say the least.... This is my 4th time here and I wouldn;t have gone here so many times if it wasn't the proximity to MCC. Each and everytime I have been rather dissapointed with teh level of service which has been slow and blase at the best of times.  This time around I had to wait 20 miniutes at teh sushi bar (after my order) before teh chef showed up. By then I had lost interest in suchi and Saketini as a whole. I would understand if this place was crowded but there were only 2 other groups and that too none of them were at the bar.  Note to self: Never venture here again

9l9u4ttt1HEvZCIziHRVlg.text: I'm surprised this place isn't busier on the weekdays!!! It's literally happy hour all the time. The food is good and the drink specials are pretty good too. Definitely one of our go-to places when we're on this side of town.

mDM2BEjiIiQB937NYl2mSg.text: This place was nice! Kinda tucked away but definitely good. The happy hour menu isn't bad at all and in my book they get a lot of props for having creative rolls that actually taste good.   Good Service.   Nice Ambiance.   Its all good!

O-KHE57GQ8YxUfxIwAE3hQ.text: I come here often since its right in my neighborhood. Low key atmosphere, servers are nice although service can be too slow at times. Decent sushi. I tend to go between the hours of 6-10 so I can get half off on certain menu items. I do have one suggestion.... dont try the calamari. They're more like calamari sticks and not rings. But they weren't tasty at all.

ysce3AsBitc1YlexomwUHg.text: I've only been here once, but as far as that experience goes..it was amazing. We got the Rattlesnake, Little mermaid, Cinderella, & edamame. Everything was so so good. Especially for going in with zero expectations..(good sushi in az is just too hard to find) So many creative rolls, an extensive menu and the server was patient and sweet, even though we had a table of 12 + 2 Rowdy kids. $1 well drinks and $2.50 beers. The place plays music, but not too loudly.  Food is so much better than RA. Can't wait to go back again.

kUBTFxoKbonI9Xx5blRU1g.text: I convinced my boyfriend to try this place with me after searching for local sushi spots around mesa. he was like "sushi and karaoke? that doesn't sound too good." But we tried it and I was surprised at how clean and modern-looking it was! We've been going for the last six months and every time we have friendly and excellent servers. The sushi is great too--especially when they do their specials! They have sakebomb specials Monday nights I think, and happy hour and reverse happy hour! My favs are the cinderella roll and crunchy cali. always so fresh!

nFfC6vjltTSv4psPW9q2jQ.text: Went there at 11pm.  Ordered the ramen and it was awful.  Tasted and looked exactly like shin instant ramen. Sushi is good for the price.  Especially happy hour.

aRWmRe_0YfwwJZ-0uey4Cw.text: The reason I am leaving 3 stars is because they are in major need of renovations both inside and out. Their outside appearance is not at all appealing. Heaven forbid you need to use the restroom, you'll have nightmares. I seriously hold it until I get home, which by the way is a 15 minute drive. Now to get to the good stuff, their food is amazing!!! I am not one for sushi but all my friends and family love everything they have ordered from here sushi wise. I always order their ramen and they gyoza!! Both are fantastic!!! My friends and my family continue coming here because their food is great and their prices are fair. The one thing I did notice on my most recent visit is that they do add automatic gratuity now, which by the way was not even mentioned to us as we paid, and if if wasn't for one of my friends actually paying attention to their bill the waitress would have received an extra 25% tip on top of the 18% automatically charged. That honestly really annoyed myself and my companions because we all almost left way more extra tip. I don't mind places automatically including the gratuity, however we should be told so that we are aware of how much additional tip is needed so we don't over pay. Because of this I only left enough extra to get them to 20%. Some in my party who would have definitely tipped more than 18% left just the 18% since they felt wronged about not being told. It was very sneaky, not at all professional. Oh I should mention we were a party of 5 so not large and in small fine print on their menu it does state everybody will be charged automatic gratuity so doesn't matter how big or small your party is. I have been to other places that do this but I have always been made aware at the very beginning of the meal about their practices. Overall the appearance might scare you away but their food is truly great. I will continue to dine here as long as their quality of food meets my standards.

WtfLap2htA0vEcum-I2bDg.text: Food was great, service on the other hand was terrible. EXTREMELY rude sushi chefs, openly treats fellow staff terribly. Server was sweet but didn't know much about menu items and took too long to pick up bill and help us. Overall not a good experience at all

P_sWkHHZd2itF-RnxqO28g.text: Do not go!!!!!! Please read !!!!!!! Waste of $$$ and Time!!!   First- the server seemed nice and helpful but NEVR retuned until the water boy had to go get her!  2nd the food took over 45min  3rd the server dropped the sushi tray on the table and walked away never saying which one was which! Then we where confused what was just left on the table but knew she would never return! 4th the order was Messed up on the bill no happy hour prices which she said would be and added random things.  5th when we told the server about the incorrect orders on the bill/$ the host said!!!((((well u eat it)))) we where so mad but new.... I was not about to argue and have to wait another 20 min for a *Manger* to get back!   Do not go!!!!  6th ugly nasty/the restrooms look like a cheap gas station smelled and the place was falling apart!!!!!

RYy7glbRX_mK-tyWYGKuVg.text: Sushi is decent and so are the prices.  The staff really make this place. All the servers are excellent.  It's open until 2 am which is also a major plus. If sushi is not your thing the ofer plenty of alternatives which are pretty good.  There's also a private room available for parties which is a blast to rent out and not too pricey.  I'll continue to stop by here every week.

vAPxGx9N5PrfHA1K2CXojw.text: Nothing sticks out about Saketini that makes it great, so I'm not sure why the average rating is so high.  My friend and I got there on a Monday night around 5:45. The place was dark and practically empty. I started getting panicky that we would not get our orders in before happy hour ended at 6. The server came and brought us water at 5:50 and then didn't come back until right before 6. We made happy hour, but barely. I don't know why the server was taking her time - there was one other table so it's not like it was busy. Hate when people make me nervous.  Anyway, to the rolls. They have a huge list of specialty rolls, but 95 percent of them are deep-fried, baked, stuffed with cheap imitation crab or cali rolls. Only a few had fresh fish in them. So far, not impressed.   We ordered the spicy salmon and tuna, which were big, chunky and quite spicy. I was happy with these. I ordered a Dbacks specialty roll which was tasty but not amazing. My friend and I shared the Mermaid, which was half price after 6:30, and that was OK. Again, nothing to write home about. Specialty rolls range from $8-12, but they're stuffed with the cheap stuff, so I don't know if they're worth it.  In the end, we had 5 rolls, no drinks and the bill came out to $35, which, if the quality was superb, I would not have had a problem with. I don't think I'd go back, it just wasn't worth it.

NC1SDBo-9HPskOizm5QjVQ.text: Pretty good good. I had the volcano roll, which is baked. Came out pretty quickly for a baked dish.  It was a bit too "fishy" to my taste and lacked seasoning. But the service was great. Friendly courteous waitress and chillaxed environment that won't blow your eardrums out.  Bit on the pricy side.

3nRXqYuL-PBvYF2oei3Bng.text: "Worst service everrr.  I don't recommend this fake sushi bar to anyone... " is what i thought when i went there and they double booked the karaoke room.. i am still sore about that, because they did not offer all 25 of us any compensation at all. I have been there a couple times since, and i have not had a problem.

e09aPKA2ekMIRL1ESRrZOw.text: This place is great. The happy hour is a great deal. The dinner salads are only $3 and big and the ginger dressing was yummy. I got the Alaska roll and the doggy bag roll and shared with my 2 year old. The rolls are fat and so so good.

QMZneB8HInLJHv79nV7mgA.text: Over all a bit too busy and hip for me. Service was a bit slow, but the sushi was  well prepared, delicious and well presented. They did serve me Masago instead of Tobiko, and I did notice.  But I am giving them 4 of 5 anyway. Yes, it was that delicious.

3w5bv-LGKai2X3DApLtRxA.text: Karaoke:  I love to karaoke here!  The cheapest place to karaoke as it is only 5 bucks a person and the room is extremely nice in there.  The songs aren't as updated as other karaoke places, but it's neat how they have a lot of different songs in different Asian languages.    Food:  The taste is alright, but the prices are cheap.  The servers are really nice, but the service can be really slow as they have very few workers in there.

g-79icQzsiOSwb9cwT6Vng.text: On Saturday I ended up doing an interview for this establishment for an assignment for one of my classes. And I have to say, the owner is so down to earth, and the employees were all great. The food was all delicious, and extremely well presented.  The decorations were really minimalistic but I enjoyed that aspect of it. It's well executed for a fusion of both Asian decorations as well as American. The service was great and the deals are unbeatable in terms of sushi and drinks.  I will definitely be coming again.

miqTb9fg0rWwwNbcUOW8Kw.text: This place is cool!  Almost any time of day they have some rolls or apps on special.  3-6 PM is when the most stuff is on happy hour though.  I tried the Jelly Fish roll: had spicy octopus and cucumber with cream cheese inside.  I had to pick the cream cheese out (I find cream cheese in sushi revolting) but otherwise it was great! I also got salmon nigiri and the spicy tuna roll. Overall the fish tasted very fresh to me. But watch out for the spicy tuna! I couldn't eat it all because it was so spicy!  I'd definitely come here again. My dining companion and I were full and our total bill was only $20.52!

I9JOt6ueHwsRUYAxcgw_Yw.text: Have been going to this place for years and it is my favorite sushi place by far. The servers are always super friendly and their food is amazing! They have great prices with all their happy hours and I love how late they're open! Favorite date place for my boyfriend and I by far!

zH9rZ0SdWyahITDD_cB5CA.text: This place has a bunch of great sushi rolls. They are a little pricier than some other places but their sushi is better than a lot of places so I feel they are fairly priced for what you get and have "half off" prices on many of their rolls during their happy hour. Cocktails are good and the service is always fast and the waitresses are friendly.

6GvuaF_oZE_D1KSRLzgwgQ.text: This place was great! Went here around ten on a friday night. They have a great reverse happy hour and I haven't had sushi this good since I was in San Diego! Definitely beat what I expected going in. The bar service could have been a little better (we were the only two at the bar so it shouldn't have been too difficult to pay attention given there were two bartenders) but overall really great! Food was awesome service was ok!

_ka-zvEzBRTyT0syH77fqA.text: I like the food. Sushi roll are really good portions. Fast and good customer service. Good taste over all and great prices.The only thing that did gross me out was that outside of the location there was a sewer problem and there was basically feces and toilet paper coming out of a hole in the ground,which was really Gross. I don't know if it was the restaurant itself or if it was the Plaza but it was very very close to the restaurant.

HmwBkcl4R_PAqGE9dg8Vyw.text: My friend and I finished a workout and realized we were hungry and craving sushi.  We were frantically trying to find a place to eat sushi that was open late.  First of all, there aren't that many great sushi places in the Valley, simply because the fish is not fresh like any of the coastal states.  We were still on a mission.  Saketini's was open pretty late so we made stop over here.  We got a sashimi platter, albacore with crab roll, and a few other things.  The albacore with crab roll (forgot name) was very delicious.  Some of the sashimi peaces were good, but some were not as great.  Overall, we got our fix of sushi at a very late hour.  One thing that drops the rating of the restaurant is we got an automatic 20% tip added on.  We were only a party of two.  I usually leave a pretty good tip, but I do not like it when a restaurant mandates a tip.  A tip is something I feel is up to the customer based on his experience.

ba8ogHy6WcFUYpxmKQGTeA.text: My hubby and I love this place. We drive down from north phoenix (Dunlap & I-17) for their sushi. We just cannot find a place in PHX that has sushi as good as Saketini. Sushi is always fresh, waitresses are always attentive, and we have NEVER had an extra gratuity added to our bill- and we went there for Valentine's. We recommend the Signature roll. Happy hour and reverse happy hour are great too.

XVF6YL897jadQs0M9zWNFg.text: Best place for sushi! They have a happy hour from 6-10 and then a reverse at 10-1. They also have daily specials for drinks depending on the day of the week.

_wgKwxsNyvSBwhiwCn9QAA.text: I love sakitini . However I was really disappointed because I called at 12:50 to order a California roll to go. Ps, They close their kitchen at 1AM. The guy on the phone told me they closed their kitchen down early because it was slow. Honestly, I work in a restaurant I get it but you can't just pick and choose when you want to close down the kitchen. What makes it worse is that their open until 2!!!! Unsatisfied customer.

M7l1p4VTXeGOxAR3wF9jGQ.text: Went here for a late night sushi craving and ordered tuna,yellowtail and salmon sashimi,  red dragon, WTH, cherry blossom and the rattle snake rolls.    The sashimi was good,  our yellowtail slices where small and thin compared the big thick cuts of salmon and tuna.    All the rolls were very good,  slices could have been sliced a tad bit thinner,   all the cuts were about an inch thick.  Definitely not bit size pieces but it sure didn't fall apart.   The food overall I would have to give it a 4 star.    The reason it got demoted to 3 stars is due to the fact that the bill came out with gratuity of $17 on a bill of $95 before tax.  I understand the need for yours automatic gratuity charge and it is usually used for parties of 6 or more...But it was only a party of 2!!!!

ieaGK2fotGdVCHfXBGyIOQ.text: Their rolls are super inventive....and they stay open later than most Sushi Places in the Valley (2am).    Their Happy Hour is insane! Ex: 99 cent beers on Tuesday!  I've never had a disappointing meal here, and I am pretty hard to please when it comes to sushi.  Recommendations: Signature Roll Squid Salad Yellowtail Collarbone Drinks, Drinks...drinks.  They have a little karaoke room, and full bar you can make use of as well.  1 Thing: When it's busy, be prepared to order everything at once...or you will be waiting.

3Pjo81rKZsa-GHK3DmYBqA.text: I really love the sushi. It's our regular hot spot for when we want to go eat some. Everything is great from the food to the staff. My only issue is that they don't honor the great prices when you order out. I feel like they are losing business this way. Every time we're too lazy to go out and eat we want to place a take out order. However, when the prices cost double the amount, we typically will shoot for a different place to order take out from. So we don't get food from here as often as we want to. Sad.

718aMJGFupR3fd1_8RCTmg.text: This has got to be the worst place ever ! Saw roaches crawling in the bathroom. Sushi maker doesn't use gloves and saw him taking out trash and then came back and made more sushi!!!The waitresses add their own gratuity to your your bill! Even if it's just one person they add whatever they want to their bill. When asked to speak to supervise they make excuses that managers are available. Please check your receipts as they add whatever amount they want as their tip. STAY AWAY FROM THIS FILTHY PLACE

3NGUTIyDQCtfI6OXd2W7rQ.text: I have visited this place several times in the past. They have a decent happy hour and daily specials. But after my last visit, I will never be back!   A couple of friends and I stopped in last night for some late night happy hour sushi and drinks. The service in the past has usually not been the best. However, this time our server, Tony, was actually on point.  I ordered my usual Fire Cracker dish and a friend ordered the chicken gizzards. His food was okay but he literally pulled out about half a cup of slivered garlic pieces. WAY TOO MUCH GARLIC!! Mine tasted fine as usual so not too bad there. Our bills were a reasonable price for all we got. So we left fairly happy with our experience.   The reason I am giving this place only 1 star is because of the torture I went through after getting home from dinner. I got the worst food poisoning I have ever had to deal with in my life. I had to make a trip to urgent care this morning after being glued to the toilet all night!   Thanks a lot Saketini!! I won't forget this experience for quite some time.

B73cHHpl14etFTa3fjz6Hw.text: I love this place however,  I called today before 8 o'clock and asked what time reverse happy hour began. The guy on the phone told me at 10 o'clock.  I said great.  Then I asked what specials they had currently.  He said yes and that the sushi was currently half off and that it wasn't limited to just the 13 rolls on the reverse happy hour menu.  I then asked to speak with the manager and the manager want really helpful.  She took $2 off the bill.  Had the guy on the phone communicated clearly, we would have come after 10pm.  Guess we will have to stick with Teharu.

dZjE45BzGIXpy-qVA8Ztrw.text: Just went here for dinner, it was the worst $100 I ever spent.  The first set of salmon shisimi was great so I decided to get a second and I get salmon chunks.  Finish my Pepsi and my son finish his water but not once did the server ask if we would like a refill and got charge 18% gratuity for poor service. Never would go back!!!!

LHNwXkONV0_YY-Yy_MPIYA.text: The food is ok but there are a few good things about this place. We go here all the time.  1. It's open late so you can definitely get some great food at night. And there is also a reverse happy hour. 2. The waitress allowed a party of 24 to get separate checks. That was really helpful. She made sure she wrote our names down and was a pretty good server. 3. There's also a karaoke room. You can reserve it for a group and it's $5 per person 4. The decor is pretty nice too and there are TVs that show sports.  The main thing about the food is that it's ok but at a high price. Definitely had better at a lower price. And the ramen, don't bother getting it. It tastes like store bought package ramen in spicy watered down soup. I had REAL Japanese Ramen, and the one here doesn't compare.  Just make sure you come during regular happy hour for good prices. If you come late at night, there's reverse happy hour which gives you ok prices on a few items.

n18Gk2cQKakF7p4W3Myi6g.text: My girlfriend and I have been coming here for around 4 years now. The sushi is great! They have reasonable portions with a large variety of different types of sushi. I suggest the "Firecracker" or "Cinderella" rolls.   As for there other food options, I have not tried very many but the Ramen was pretty good and the "Chicken Katsu" was delicious as well.   The service use to be terrible here. We didn't care because we loved the food so much but I'm happy to say that within the last year the service is much better! They are quick to take your order and we never have any issues with refills. All of the servers are bubbly and very nice as well.   Although the place may look dingy (it's a little run down and could use a remodel), do not let that affect your decision to dine here. Enjoy the happy hour, and happy eating!

DHXooX1amFx5wvnsEDqC1g.text: Food was okay but beware of the "auto-tip" scam, even on a party of 2!

3BUqoGeR5DUdCOz7Ajxj5g.text: Very very expensive, food...never order it, service...none. WOW!!! This place really tops every & any place I have ever been. Came here late at night because I wanted some soju & something to pick at but it was a huge mistake from my end! SORRY!!!

7yr6gmd1sHyE91-OPemGdQ.text: It is horrible to think this used to be one of our favorite places and now run by young college kids who do not have much respect. We love the sushi but the service just is not there.   The fact that we had gratuity added to our bill already for only a two person check is mind blowing. When asked about it, she stumbled to find the words and ended with because it was a holiday(Valentine's Day) and she wanted to make sure she got her tips.... really?! She also stated she was new and this is just how she does it... again really?!  Then when called the next day to ask about it with a manager we are told that a manager is not available and no supervisor either. Not until Friday and we can cal back then... do I say it again really?! So your to tell me no person other than the workers who seem to now be ripping people off are there to speak to me?!   I again love the sushi and have driven all the way from the back of Gilbert to specifically go to Saketini because we have been going since they opened. Now my feeling is that I will feel more secure maybe going some where else since they don't seem to care either!

xKuJob59do8TjrMtvNIomQ.text: Please look else for sushi. Place is nasty. Salmon is really old and Mushy. The sushi looked like it was made by amateurs. Service placed gratuity on our bill for 2 people. I don't think he thought we were going to notice and was trying to get more of a tip. Watch out for them

92Gitz6PR9KrOsC-5eFJLg.text: No Frills Sushi.    Saketini is the place to go for good inexpensive (not cheap) sushi. It is a bit of a dive but I'd rather pay for good food not decor. There are specials all day long but our favorite time is dinner for the half price sushi rolls. They have a selection of ten full size rolls for $4.50. The Blonde and I can enjoy a filling meal for under $30. Our personal favorites are the Idaho, the Cinderella and the December 24th. We often add a Vegas or a Rainbow Roll, both of which are not on the happy hour list.    Our group of 16 people this night (normal dining for us is 2 to 4 people) was very diverse, from children the had never had sushi, a couple people that don't care for sushi, and an U.S. Air Force member that had previously been stationed on Okinawa. They created a large rectangular table arrangement for us so we could converse with everyone. The staff was very helpful answering all questions, keeping water glasses full, finding non-spicy, non-sushi items on the menu for the finicky ones, supplying chopsticks with helpers for the less dexterous ones, and meeting the last second requests for extras.    Overall, everyone was pleased with the experience. Our Air Force member complimented the quality of the sushi and ultra-finicky Grandma even enjoyed the tempura shrimp and egg rolls. The Ramen bowls were large and had a nice presentation of fresh vegetable on top. The Blonde and I shared 4 rolls, each was very flavorful and the fish on top of the Rainbow Roll was thinly sliced and very tasty. These sushi rolls are well made and stand up to my heavy handed use of chopsticks. The entire meal was nicely presented as it should be since sushi is edible art.    This is a hidden gem. They are open until 2 AM making it an ideal spot for a late bite to eat. It is rarely busy enough to require a long wait for a table, even at dinner time.  Warm Fuzzies (the good stuff) -Half price sushi happy hour. -Open late. -Daily happy hour specials at the bar. -Well done Sushi rolls and Nigri. -Quiet place for couples. -Pleasant, helpful staff.  Cold Baldies (the not so good stuff) -Full bar but the selection is not huge. -Looks like a bit of a dive. -Needs a website.

photos.caption: Photo of Saketini Japanese Sushi Bar and Lounge - Mesa, AZ, United States. Dinner for 3. Half price Happy Hour rolls and nigiri.

Cgd0SEDo8mow-kOMRGetLA.text: It's not the best sushi I've eaten but I'm not very picky about sushi in general-i love it all. With that saying, I enjoyed my meal. I had a Philly roll and shrimp tempura. My waitress was nice and even though they had gotten busy, there was always someone who came by to check on us. My only gripe and this probably has nothing to do with the restaurant itself is how ghetto it was. There was a raucous group inside and a loud, drunk dude shouting at the bar. Mind you this was at 5pm. I walked outside afterwards and some girl was giving some guy a lap dance at the entrance...I don't know maybe they need some security?

476Vhs33QFnIevz-tsubVw.text: Absolutely amazing fish, great chicken teriyaki, awesome service, really reasonable prices, beautiful decor.   If you don't like loud music, don't go here, but even if you don't, its worth it to have the Tuna Nigiri!!

3CQV0Bzv3dUhjkgHcxiLrA.text: Really like this place! We've gone a few times and each time the service has been great and the food has been yummy! We order 2 rolls each off of the happy hour menu and it's usually around $20 which is great for the budget

yVRC2O6q33POkAf9si3Pyg.text: I actually love this place and that it is open late but it's always bugged me that they seem to refuse to maintain the building.   For the last few years the men's sink is broke, the wall out front is falling apart, thier stick on tiles are falling off the wall  and missing where you eat by the bar.   Add in that when the power went out the emergency lights had not been maintained or serviced, out of curiosity I've checked for the last two years on the one on the men's room.. It has never worked and I've check it out of boredom when ever I'm here.   Seriously, if you can't maintain this place with the obvious items that are staring you in the face, it makes me ask are you cutting corners elsewhere in places that matter?   It's disappointing at best.   I'll continue being a patron  just hoping the corner cutting doesn't ever result in me getting sick.

XawNMnDGFDi7I64jDY2xDw.text: Pluses: -happy hour is pretty good -the hours of operation are nice, always great to have a late-night sushi place.  Middle-of-the road: -service is inconsistent. A shame, because it used to be decorated very smartly. Lots of 'cracks' are starting to show all over.

6Ln573bW6Um0dUCbQQ-slg.text: We usually like this place for late dinner. But tonight was kinda disappointed. First of all, the girl who seated us seems a little bit impatient. There was only like one or two table sitting there when we got in. And she seated me and my husband in a very small table. We just switched to a bigger table ourselves. Food was ok. Our server was good at most of the time. But later on he just kinda rush to take off the plate while we still working on it. Same thing for the check. We were still eating! Then here comes the worst thing: THEY CHARGE US TIPS FOR US (ONLY 2 people)!!! Are you kidding me? I have never had a restaurant charge tips for only 2 people! We usually tip out 20% after tax. Too bad!

OzOHqurrVjYhxpDzC0KPtA.text: Loved this place. It wasn't very busy when we arrived which made me wonder a little bit. But we were pleasantly surprised. The sushi was very fresh, the service was excellent, and the prices were extremely affordable. We will be going back. My daughter loved the chopsticks they put together for her to help her pick up her food.

vkzlH200g9KGMLZ02lPIvA.text: This place is pretty good. For some reason every time I go there aren't many people in there but the environment is nice. The Happy Hour deals don't seem like much for me but the Half Off Sushi is decent. There are at least two or three rolls for me there as I do not eat any raw sushi, I only eat the cooked or baked rolls. I like their ideas for rolls and their presentation is nice. They seem to have a good variety for all types of sushi lovers. Some of the rolls are very pricey though so be prepared to possibly spend over $10 on certain rolls.

JZQprH0aEurh7fZypbMaRQ.text: One of our go to places for inexpensive sushi.   They have great service and a wonderful happy hour.   They have a bar, sushi bar, and table seeting.  We usually go early when it is dead quite and we have the place all to ourselves.   We really like it.

Vxpfe6xXk-Bv6U68uFFXOw.text: Great sushi!  It's fresh and tastes delicious!  I normally frequent RA Sushi but I could no longer deal with the over packed, over priced food and drinks.  Now the outside of the establishment will fool you; it could use a nice clean up.  The inside is clean, nicely decorated, and quite inviting.  We went for happy hour ($2) wells-can't beat it.  The sushi had pictures (I need pictures) it was reasonably priced for regular price but many was on happy hour!  I always get the "Viva Las Vegas Rolls" at RA Sushi and decided to give it a try here...SUPERB! I received more of the roll and cost much less.  I also tried the spicy tuna which was excellent as well.  All I can say is they have a new fan...I will be back again and again.   The service was really good as well.  I never had to request refills or ask twice for anything.

SEz8Nzq2fO7FNVCTh1W5Qw.text: First time here. Was a little concerned upon entry, with their picture book menu, but the sushi is freaking great. Went with a regular spicy maki, and a fire roll. Upon delivery I realized the fire had avocados in it. I'm not allergic, but my stomach HATES them. The waitress sensed my disdain after she witnessed me double checking the menu. She said it would be no problem to replace it, and the chef didn't even seem mad. I'll be back.

JC4ToBK2Jq6TRhPrvtRIaA.text: Ive been meaning to come here and finally made it out Friday night with Daniel!  I consider him the sushi expert, and was finally ready to see what all the hype was about.  We came in Friday night and the place was dead.  I mean not a soul but one guy sitting in the corner.  Where was everyone?  We sat down and the server came right over and gave us our menus and took our drink orders.  They seem to have a decent drink menu here and we both ordered chocotinis.  The drinks came out and they were tasty!  YUM!!  Anyways, we ended up ordering some food, and whatever we did end up eating was delicous!  (Daniel the expert did the ordering knowing that I am new to this.  We did a few different things and they were delicious.)  Place is cute and well decorated.  Being a novice to this, I was happy with the taste and display of the food that we ate.  I really had a good time here.  As the night went on, we did end up seeing more people come into the resturant,  but that wasn't for a while.  Service was great, and overall I had a good experience.  Will return in the future.

xZF9m5gtMLmo5JSyUVmBYA.text: To me, this is my favorite sushi spot and has been since I moved up to the Tempe area back in 2009. The Chefs are really friendly and service is great for the most part.   Now, I only really get sashimi so if you really like sashimi, this place has- according to me- has some of the better tasting ones I have had around here. It's a great atmosphere and i'm probably bias because of my history here.   Happy hour and reverse happy hour are great so if you haven't tried this place at least try it at those times! Try the albacore and salmon, delicious!

6YLjTnqpwuKLh7_bX4cRxA.text: We mainly come here for karaoke but the sushi I've had is not that bad  The karaoke is average the machine could be a bit better and they placed it weirdly outside the room so you have to point it awkwardly till the number spits out. They also seem to charge a $20 flat rate with an added 18% gratuity no matter what.  We got the cherry blossom roll (they mistakenly label it as maki) packed with tuna and salmon. Was quite crudely made but I'm willing to let it slide as we ordered at 1:29 am and they still made it for us even though it was cutting it close.  The fish quality could be better but I'm giving it a pass because it is Arizona (far from the sea, less seafood consumption)  Quite pricey though 12.99 for a semi-decent product Will definitely keep location in mind where I move in the future in accordance to seafood.... Arizona is not it

Bu-KU5gqdXGxdIL_wJdnCg.text: Love this place pretty decent sushi for a good price, I love that they have happy hour and reverse happy hour. They're even open till 2am for when I'm craving sushi for a midnight meal:) Only reason I gave it 4stars is that the service is slow sometimes

q_zcsThkMAVVeD-UIsySLQ.text: Word to the wise, the last two times I have been to this place, they have added the tip to the check. Now, I understand if there are 8 or more people in a party but there were 2 people once and 3 people the other time. That alone will prevent me from ever going back there.

DU9DKCQdCUWssO5S-4bnsw.text: Original plan was to come in for reverse happy hour but we ended up there at 9pm. So glad, because they have half price sushi on weekdays from 6-10. We ordered 3 rolls from the half price selection and were totally wowed. We both agreed it was the best sushi either of us have ever had. Very fresh and excellent sauce. Service was top notch, very attentive. Our food came very quickly even though they place was so full that we had to sit at the bar. Can't wait to go back for more!

ElQz9jL9XX-uSuCDNO7ndw.text: Tuesdays are all night happy hours (when one ends, the reverse begins), and Mondays and Thursdays after 6:30 they have a collection of 1/2 off rolls.  Can't speak too much for the drink specials because I always get their signature saketini, which is made with absolut and some green tea liqeuor. I highly recommend this drink because it's smooth, slightly sweet, and has that nice green tea flavor I just love.  We're pretty boring when it comes to rolls--got the crispy california, the shrimp tempura and the firecracker, which was a jumbo jalepeno popper with spicy crab in it. Oh man, it was all glorious. I've had the spicy tuna there also, and the dragon. It's all good to me.  They always have some crazy creation on the sushi board and the staff is always friendly. You're better off sitting at the bar--we go for games--as it seems the servers are more attentive there (or at least they're always back there doing stuff).  Try it, and keep a business alive.

Their prices are so reasonable and I love how late they are open! This is my go to place and probably my favorite restaurant! PBrWxip1dGdsLQEU2FS3mg.text: I really enjoyed their happy hour! The prices were great (we got three appetizers, three special rolls, and wine for ~30). The sushi also tasted really fresh, which can be hard to find at such low prices.   I was a little confused when they charged extra for wasabi and additional sauces, but overall I really liked this modern sushi spot.

la8JfD0xw3Ukvqf9VhT91A.text: I want to give Saketini a better review, because I've happily been eating here for years. But they've done me dirty a few times recently, so I can't.   The last 2 occasions the blonde female bartender auto-gratuity'd our bill... on a 2-top? We were weekly regulars until this dishonesty happened... twice. I guess if what you want is an 18% tip I'll give it to you, but generally ya'll deserve a bit more for the attentive and friendly service. Ultimately I feel like you're trying to swindle me into not realizing the tip is built into the bill and have me still tip you on top of that. i glanced at other reviews before posting and noticed this is a common theme so I don't feel wrong in my accusations. Also, I have recently worked in the restaurant industry, and had for about 8 years, and I seem to remember that all restaurants in AZ did away with auto-gratuity back in 2013. Seems a little fishy.   So, aside from this bullshit, I'll give an honest review of the food. They make some delicious plates.   They open at 3pm, and run 3 different happy hour specials. I liked to go at 5:30 to take advantage of the special that ends at 6 and the new one that starts. The one that starts at 6 has some of my favorite rolls (Little Mermaid, December 24, Idaho, Cinderella, Fire, Doggy Bag, Bronze Medal .. IN THAT ORDER!). I only ever order Mermaid & December recently but the others I listed will also satisfy your Americanized sushi hunger.   Titanic is my absolute favorite roll. I'm going to update this review when I can recall what fish is on it, but it's ginormous and topped with fresh yummy seafood. No extra distracting sauces, and you'll struggle to pop a whole piece in your mouth.   Mondays are 5$ Sake-Bombers with your choice of a giant Sapporo or Kirin! Normally 8$ so Monday is a good time.

Bj2fAmWOeCSh8Wtu9CcU1A.text: Amazing happy hour and reverse happy hour . A great place for those just trying sushi.

vBA-X7z9FAwXHk-fBoSO1A.text: Wow. I have not had such a tailored experience in a long time. ISAAC realized I was in a rush and quickly got me my drink. I ordered only a couple drinks and nigiri, all off of the reverse happy hour menu, but that did not affect Isaac's service. He was so gracious. Need more like him!

NvfbmS16U7fEw-gjb6DMSQ.text: Reigning duchess speaking!  My coworkers and I visit this place almost every Saturday. This is our go to spot after work since the food is alright, and they close late. (Call around 1 am though cos even if they close later than that the kitchen might close earlier if they're not busy). They have a full bar, great happy hour prices and unbeatable daily specials. Why not 5 stars though? Because the food is not spectacular. It's never bad though. Great place for drinking with friends. Servers are all cute and friendly. The manager is always behind the sushi bar, meticulously looking at everything. I was just here yesterday, and the week before that and most likely next week...so see you there!

Photo of Saketini Japanese Sushi Bar and Lounge - Mesa, AZ, United States. $3 drafts on Fri &amp; Sat

ohf1hfSt5YQjS8sA7ahClQ.text: This is the closest sushi place to me after Crazy Sushi & Crab (see previous review) and Senor Sushi (due to reviews, I have no plans to go here.) I live in the heart of Mesa's Asian Business District, so I rarely venture outside of it for the foods that I love.   Saketini has a decent happy hour and several rolls. People love this place and are regulars. I've been a couple of times and even brought friends. One of the last times I ordered off the happy hour menu I thought, wow there's a lot of crab mix in here (a roll that the main ingredient was supposed to be tuna.) I gave them the benefit of the doubt and thought, well maybe they're just having an off day. I went back this weekend and was disappointed, because they're stuffing the rolls with crab mix when that's not what is being advertised; the last time wasn't a fluke. If I wanted a California roll (which is not even proper sushi), I would have ordered one. I asked the waiter if he could ask the chef about it and the waiter began to argue with me and eventually said, well it's probably just to bring costs down. I said, oh okay I understand, we'll take the check. I won't go back. If you claim to be a sushi place, why are you cutting corners? It's a culture, it's an art. Maybe their specialty rolls are better and the happy hour rolls are a scheme to make extra money with small portions? Who knows. I'm not really interested in going back. Really, it's a shame, I liked going there.  Side note: I feel like an absolute fool for forgetting that Toh Zan Nagasaki Grill is within WALKING distance from Saketini, has glowing reviews, and every time I drive by I go, "I still need to go in there! Definitely a Japanese mom and pop place." I've looked at the menu and it looks amazing and well priced. I will be going there the next time I am craving sushi.

PgdQ7wPZqXwgYUchNP1npg.text: I give this place 5 stars for being exactly what it markets itself to be.  Decent sushi, attentive service & GREAT prices - there is some "happy hour" special at all times of the day, always consistent in quality, never fishy, etc.    Servers are friendly, helpful, easy to understand, and they play remixed trendy music - creating perfect atmosphere!   Good green tea Moochi dessert. I have been plenty of times, and will continue to frequent this place.   Only suggestion is offer free wifi. I would sit and work (and eat more sushi) if I could get wifi on my laptop.   Tuna sashimi is always perfectly seasoned and fresh. Definite recommendation.

Our server was great, unfortunately I don't remember her name, but she was very helpful and even told us that some of the sushi rolls were half off because of their happy our for them. I definitely recommend coming here

LlaTh2K5uhEoG87HXzMK9Q.text: I always come here for happy hour as that is when the best prices are. Most of the rolls are HUGE though, so about 2 orders should fill you up unless you are starving. I haven't had a bad experience here, but many of the rolls are very similar in ingredients and therefore are lacking in variety. But if you're just looking to fill up and aren't ingredient picky, by all means, this is a good place to get your fill.

aTTteJpjcPgreCV68FG7Tw.text: The food was OK. Most of the rolls were fried or had something fried in it. Service was not good. When we walked in there was only one employee in the restaurant. After 5 or so minutes the rest of the employees returned from what smelled like a smoke break and they proceeded to ridicule the bartender for taking our order (they said he was being selfish and cussing in Spanish) we could basically hear everything they were saying. Unprofessional, dark, not exceptional by any means. Sorry to say.

cignYY42fva3hVDcM1BikA.text: The vile arrogance that I experienced tonight was utterly unyielding.  A family that was simply attempting to get a to-go box for the food in which they wanted to enjoy later were treated and targeted with the utmost disrespect.  This family was denied a to-go box because of the pigment of their skin, as the workers attempted to call the police on them for no reason what so ever.   I am disgusted. I am embarrassed. I am never returning to this establishment, because I refuse to tolerate bigotry and absolute racism.

ogj73rYiNf4Pd-s8wb1V3A.text: Because the rolls were somewhat okay, it saved this place from 1 star. Came in Sunday night during happy hour to place an order to go. Waited to be greeted for five minutes while the hostesses had their back towards us refusing to acknowledge us.  Finally a waiter came over to ask us if we've been helped.    After we review the menu we place the order, we find out they won't honor the happy hour pricing.  The menu doesn't say eat in only... but whatever.  Ordered a rainbow roll, none of the fish was cut correctly.   December 24th and cherry blossom rolls were pretty good.  Yellow fish roll was just okay.  Idaho roll was pictured with more masago... better off just buying the Californian roll for half the price.   Overall we were unhappy with our experience, especially in regards to customer service.  For the price, literally anywhere else would be better.

pgZ7H0Ebr6ljCOy4wY6ONw.text: Sushi and food was good however the service was not the best. Our server didn't want us to keep a menu as we were going to order more sushi and was not very attentive to the table. We felt rushed and didn't feel as if we could relax and enjoy the atmosphere. It was almost as if she wanted us to leave because the place had a waiting list but they just opened. When the bill came I was surprised to see gratuity of 18% was added automatically for four people. When I asked about it she said the system automatically adds it if the bill is over $60. Didn't feel the service was worth the 18%. I would have given at least 15% even with the ok service but shouldn't have to be required to give 18% if we were not given good service. I would be cautious for those who wouldn't expect this. Just wished our service was better

YX2B12AOBZc5HtBRVK68HQ.text: My girlfriend and I went there for the first time the sushi is excellent ordered the  chicken teriyaki and It was very disappointing very small portion compared to many other places I've been too,  The other thing is the ambience is very uncomfortable you have employees just standing there watching you eat it seems, wont be going back!!

I2GVoGIjlmWaQOpyTSpf3A.text: "I think that without sushi, there would be no David Hasselhoff because sushi is like the perfect way of describing the insides of David Hasselhoff. He is like a protein, clean and easy. That's how I feel about myself."  David Hasselhoff  This place is decent.  Friendly staff, ample seating, open until 2AM, there's a karaoke room, et cetera.  They even have a generous amount of time allotted for Happy Hour and Reverse Happy Hour.  Too bad the rolls are small and mediocre for the price they're asking.  I mean $7 for barely any salmon skin?  You're kidding me, right?  And $7 for a cocktail with barely any booze makes this girl sad.  Oh well.  I only come here when out-of-state and out-of-country friends want to mingle.

photos.caption: Photo of Saketini Japanese Sushi Bar and Lounge - Mesa, AZ, United States. Reverse HH rolls: Salmon Skin and Philly Roll.
Photo of Saketini Japanese Sushi Bar and Lounge - Mesa, AZ, United States. Small hot sake.

coFvPfMlZTIvSdxsLJLiIw.text: This place is amazing! Food & drinks are yummy and very cheap! Service has always been good! Issac & Alex are wonderful!!

V3KQHsX0v9T5eTWJ77c18w.text: Great sushi and good drinks. Friendly staff and great happy hours

QAcU-nHKMlU4j7XnuB9ssw.text: This place looks like it's closed from the outside. It's kinda sketchy looking. The service was okay. But why are the girls working there almost half naked?! It's kinda gross trying to eat sushi when the waitresses shorts look like UNDERWEAR. It's disgusting. Our food came out quick.  I had the chicken teriyaki and for it being $13 I expected it to be an amazing tasting plate. It lacked a lot of flavor and the serving was small. We also had the Vegas roll which was so good!  If I do come back it will definitely be only for the Vegas roll.  Oh and beware that if you do want extra sauce you will get charged 25 cents which is dumb for the little amount that you get.

xNv-KOQ-9t4WYokMsZyTpw.text: It is so cheap and still such good quality sushi, definitely would recommend to everyone. I like the fire cracker jalapeno sushi, it is like a jalapeno popper but better. Also we ordered two things of extra ginger and they didn't charge us any extra!

zXaxNUh9aZY8vpB-zey-QA.text: Cheap sake bomb Monday and delicious food!! As a vegetarian I eat the vege tempura and garlic edamame! Would recommend. Nice and quiet usually, but still a blast if you're in a drinking mood. The fire cracker sushi roll is also amazing for a spicy treat(non-vegetarian). Give it a try!

-4nw8P4-4nXcfc00FN7d5w.text: On my mother's birthday, the manager of the store threatened to call the cops on us after we requested to take our food down during happy hour and he refused to give us take-home boxes. This was incredibly insensitive given the fact that we are African American family, especially over something as simple as a take-out Box. They will never receive our business again, and I implore you to no longer eat here either.

_PJ71qTRKMV5c-YhNhz0QQ.text: I used to really love this place and came often and would have given 4 stars. I forgave the horribly unkempt entrance that is liken a Van Buren back alley because they had terrific food and drink specials all the time. But unfortunately all good things must come to an end and this place is no exception.The quality of sushi has taken a nose dive, and the service is borderline abusive. On our last visit I was going to speak to the manager but realized she was too busy giving a server a back rub at the sushi counter. Shame on you Sakitini.

xXtMMCwLeGMdnnXq3aY5qg.text: My next favorite Sushi bar in the valley. Service can be slow, but the Sushi chefs are always very attentive and friendly.

eUUVuO2cBpJgUPo1WC4LTw.text: The sushi was just okay.  I couldn't get past how filthy the place was.  We sat at the bar, and it was such a mess. Not sure how they pass health code.

r7vl71WKkS6Hlr6nUs-v8g.text: The menu selection is excellent.  The server asked us where we wanted to sit, but sat us somewhere completely different and she was really slow in getting us our check.  But the food was great.

NniSo8fM2mwxDMmpEPHhWg.text: I love this bar / sushi restaurant. Its open til 2AM most nights (sometimes closes early if there aren't any customers) and usually will make sushi til half past midnight! It's the only good sushi place that I know of open that late. The servers are very friendly and the food is delicious. I had a baked roll called the "Playboy" - it was AMAZING!! My new favorite roll.

LdD1_KQdbv0jf_T68r1NNQ.text: The sushi was great, fresh, with a healthy portion of fish on each piece.  The wait staff was inexperienced, but yet eager. Music was a little too loud for my taste...makes it hard to carry on a conversation without raising your voice.  The Uni was exceptional.

4QXVCMGC-9Aa4rDNbqFTUg.text: Possibly some of the best sushi I've ever had.  Go on a Sunday afternoon and sit at the bar.  The Sushi chef gave us free rolls and drinks.  If he asks if you like spicy, and you say yes, expect really really spicy.  Great place.  I will definitely return.

wN6UGxl30L9vZokxUUFAKA.text: Where else are you going to get sushi at 1am, and good sushi for that matter?  Wonderful food, staff, atmosphere, everything! With lots of variety in both the food and drink selection I love this place and visit frequently.

zqeJ0FJntvYPl5n7SinuNw.text: I have been here once and I am planning on returning. I hit the place during the lunch hour and from outside, they looked closed. Thank goodness I investigated and found out they were open at 11:30 during the week.   Warning! I am not a professed sushi genius, I have had mostly inland sushi experiences! With that said, this place was delicious. The fish was tasty and tastefully presented. There were some unique combos on the maki (rolls) menu and the service was perfect.

xR40kfLijpSj7UhujPeolA.text: The firecracker sushi is absolutely delicious! They have amazing service! Great deals during happy hour. Love the fact that they close late. My husband and I one day just happened to be sitting at the bar when the food inspector was checking temperatures in the refrigerators and everything was perfect! :)

aSpPvAWlkS6IN52V5lv3gA.text: Overly expensive for what they offer.. unless you go during happy hour its not worth it.

Fsoe7j6b9qyRF_aZG3uLSQ.text: I love this place, and their happy hour is great. The staff is really friendly too. I used to be a regular before moving far away and the staff would place my "usual order" right after walking in the door, so I didn't have to wait for my sushi. I wish I lived closer so I could go all the time!

XOBS2s6pgzeIqeGyjhS5fA.text: The fish was mediocre at best. For Nigiri, we ordered salmon, albacore, and fresh water eel. First, they gave us fatty tuna (best guess) instead of albacore. After we complained, they brought the albacore. The eel was quite bland. The salmon bordered on inedible. The rolls were competent, but nothing spectacular. The vegas roll was good, but the rainbow roll was flavorless.   the squid salad was by far the best thing we had here; in fact, the only thing I would say that was actually good!  the worst things were a tie; our waitress was terrible. there was only one other party in the entire restaurant while we were there, and the waitress was still completely inattentive.  The other half of the tie was the edamame. Someone else got to ours first; a member of my party found a maggot in her edamame! This is where the wait staff fell apart. They didn't even apologize, and didn't take it away. I had to get up and carry the edamame dishes up to the sushi bar so they wouldn't be sitting on our table! They took the edamame off the bill, but that was it.  we should have left right then, but I had heard such good things about this place, I really wanted to try the fish. what a waste of time. Needless to say, I will never again be patronizing this joint.

zR8JbVmaiIfWPHyiCWt15w.text: The food is great here and i'd love to leave 5 stars, but honestly every visit has left me upset with slow service and occasionally feeling completely ignored.

_tV76Jzp-qfTroPyXLzRFA.text: Although it's not in the nicest area, it's still a great place - love the ambiance and the food is wonderful! Sushi all around is great, but try the chicken katsu if you're not in a sushi mood. The lounge area is where I always sit.

qEAkMHd7BCLAGegN9YnQRg.text: My new favorite sushi place. From the pics it looks like you get only a few pieces for each roll, but in reality you get about 8 pieces per roll. This is the most per roll anywhere. The sushi chef is funny also.

_gL16tnGdiSjLpbf8g5x7A.text: Saketini opened not too long ago, so they're still having grand opening specials.  Get 'em while they're hot!  I haven't had their food yet, but I have partaked in their fantastic drink specials.  They have $2 well drinks for happy hour.  Woo hoo! Plus they have a reverse happy hour too, which scores them another star.  Any place that offers late night drink and food specials is alright in my book.  Once I try the food, I'll be back and I'll update the review.

VFXZEIye5apYkt2dTawzkw.text: Love this  Delicious Sushi Bar! A great place for reverse happy and happy hour specials.Great rolls that arent as common. The place is warm and friendly, service it good as well. I have yet to have a bad experience!

Iub43Qq2DYbZLPpn5p1KzA.text: The absolute best thing about this place is I can go here after work because they are open till 2AM. They are big fans of putting lots of sauce on your rolls. so if you order any rolls with sauces expect a lot more than usual. The rolls here are wrapped smaller and tighter than most but the rolls are much longer. I enjoy this place but really only go here during the late night happy hour. because the specialty rolls are about 17-24 bucks and i would much rather pay a third of the cost. the only thing I don't really like is the high price and the slow waitress. I cant really say anything bad about the food.

7nJ5trj90TZ6HcgDT7B9PA.text: One word......YUMMY!!!!  Love the whole look and feel of this place. You must try the Titanic Roll. It is to die for. Cant wait to go back.

o9CmjKbUaTbcYZuoV4WF7w.text: All I gotta say is come here for the happy hr half off sushi deals. Even though selections are limited, there's more than enough variety to satisfy that sushi craving that occurs often. Personally recommend the jelly fish rolls.   Only thing that is gratuity is automatically added to your bill which is understandable but kind of off cause sometimes the service isn't as great as the gratuity that they add on top of the bill.   Food wise & cost is great though!

tBbAIc4pwWIpy06mrRZl4g.text: I've recently been coming here with my boyfriend.. we have been all over the valley to different sushi places and this one is really good! Best advice if your into sushi is to just sit at the sushi bar. The owner and sushi chef Ray is more than welcoming and knows his stuff!! Every time we come here, Ray teaches us something new about the types of fish. I even tried for the first time Octopus and it was great! This place is now our go-to for sushi!!!

wKKCyuS9EO-DDk1uzLV-iQ.text: I have had an up and down love hate feeling with this place for a long time.  It does have good specials between happy hour and half off sushi specials they have some of the best xeals cor sushi in town. And that has kept me and my friends coming back and even over looking some issues in the past.  Issues like then randomaly putting grat on a party of 4 ? And not mentioning it .  Or issues with suoer slow service . and incorrect orders .   But just recently was the last straw that made the deals no longer worth it.  Both me and my friend got food poisoning from here. And that's just not okay. I've always told people about this place with a grain of salt and said the deals are worth some of the things wrong but now I will tell people to stay away all together. Food born illness is no joke.

KBkvA9mXrfZv5EZOh82skg.text: The one time I tried to go here they were closed due to plumbing issues however it said open on the sign so I will update later if I ever get to try the food here however considering the plumbing issues and being closed down not sure I want to go back

shm0H84p9kcUKUSaA-xVXg.text: The hygiene here has recently came to my concern. The soap in the bathroom was clearly watered down. No suds when trying to wash my hands. 2xNJahlfYoF7poZkhK8FIA.text: We came at 12:14 AM on Wednesday, they were closed  So it closes at 12 not 2 am  Also the waitress saw us outside she didn't even bother to till us that they close, she just ignored us and then turned off the lights as if she's saying they are closed Which is very rude way to do to your customers

7Cy8JEVYncXgO_1ND6unjA.text: The door by far at this location is probably one of the coolest things I've seen.  Went for drinks. Ended up getting drinks and sushi. The place was clean, our waitress was adorable and a southern bell. The food was tasty and presentation was great. Recommend. I'll definitely be back.

L2pGIRGwo2SYS7vdfzIQ8Q.text: This place has a really good happy hour special on sushi and it's worth every penny. $5 sake bombs Monday's til close. I'd give it a 5 star but some of the waitresses kind of lurk around and constantly come to your table to clean. It's nice but makes me feel like I'm being rushed and watched. Personally I like to be left alone for a bit to enjoy my dinner dates. Overall experience I give it a thumbs up and recommend this place for sushi lovers.

yLxfIhX1rrwPKVQrHyUTBA.text: Really awesome happy hour with half off appetizers from 3-6 PM and half off sushi starting at 6 PM. We got there at the unique time of 5:45. We took advantage of both happy hours. We got the Gyoza, Chicken Wings and Seaweed Salad. For the sushi, someone in my party got the Bronze Medal, another got the Crazy Boy (California Roll Deep Fried) and I got the Fire (Crab, avocado and cream cheese). Atmosphere: it says they a "Lounge" and I'm not exactly sure where that branding comes from. I did not get the vibe of a lounge. You do see the chefs making the sushi right behind the bar, which tugs at my heart strings for transparency reasons and that is awesome.   Food Selection: Honestly the best happy hour for sushi. All rolls were $4.75 (on their happy hour menu) and appetizers were around $4 or $5. They had 3 or 4 rolls that were deep fried (my FAVORITE) and were SO good. Th Gyoza sauce was also great. WARNING the sesame chicken wings are sneaky spicy. I did not try any, but my friends loved them and claimed the spiciness.   Beer Selection: honestly not that great. I get it, they don't specialize in beer. We didn't get a beer menu (which is just disappointing), and I almost ordered a bottled beer vs what was on tap because we couldn't see the tap from where we were sitting.   Customer Service: I think our experience could have been a tad bit better. There wasn't anything necessarily wrong with our server, she was just SO quiet that I could barely make out the beer options she told us. But we were able to cancel our bottled beers we ordered after we found out what was on tap, which was super sweet of her to do since they were already opened.

Kuz70yDD_8c7vGuCKOOt8g.text: This place has specials almost at all hours of the day which is a HUGE plus for my wallet. The half off sushi is also amazing, my favorite was the fire roll which is deep fried and coved in spicy mayo. Yum! The sake bomb specials is my favorite drink specials, 11 bucks for a sake bomb AND sushi? Unbeatable.

pdu-jeSvo2FfrVFXx8WnEw.text: We visit Sakitinis as often as possible. Our family loves everything in the menu! Everything is served fresh, and prompt! Clean establishment, warm atmosphere! GREAT SERVICE! Thank you Sakitinis !!!

ZQFjinb6aQRzRMOF_yNAiQ.text: My favorite spot for sushi! I'm obsessed with their lovely shrimp it's a must try! They have different specials on different days and times if the day. My favorite special is when their sake is in happy hour. The staff is friendly and always make sure you glass is full and you're taken care of. I've came here quite a few times and it's a definitely a come back type of place. I highly recommend them.

KgGBDLanGLgnIJtCXt75zw.text: About 13 of my family members and I attended this bar Friday night. They placed us in a separate section which was nice but the tv was no longer on the wall and the Houston v Rockets game was on.  A couple of us went to the bar to watch.  The service was horrible!  We waited hours for all of us to get our meals.  They forgot one Person In our group all together and by the time she got her food we were all done.  Most of us were served cold dishes. The food was decent.  None of us left tips and they're lucky gratuity was included. It was not a good place to eat at.  We won't be back.

O3xT_efy4eIaKJ5VFPl_FQ.text: My roommates and I love this spot!! We randomly came across it while looking for sushi restaurants nearby and went in and it did not disappoint. Their half off sushi rolls (6-10) were a great price for the quality and we haven't experienced anything but great service and great food. Highly recommend!!

jUeMt5XrqBeRqPhlaU0mmg.text: It's a hidden gem. I love the atmosphere and the sushi is always delicious, plus it's open late.

ZlPD8WBTRAvsdwELXmhY7w.text: K I AM A SUCKER FOR GOOD SERVICE!!! we got to saketini around 12:30 and they already put the last food order in and the chefs heard us from over the corner and were like, you know what, come on in!! so they sat us, we ordered as quickly as we could and they didn't rush us! our server so awesome and kind, and our chefs... CHEF RAY AND ANGEL ARE THE REALEST MVPS HERE! if you're craving late night sushi, this IS the atmosphere the be at!! the people are kind, the vibe is cool, and the food is even better! Young, our main food critic got the chefs choice "nigiri" and he was a big fan! the tuna was a little on the spicy side but that's something that doesn't phase young... elisabeth and i on the other hand, each enjoyed a vegas roll, and that is my type of sushi... fried crab/avocado/cream cheese/and rise is just a YES in my book.  we also ordered edamame which is also a YES, the perfect starter to a filling roll!   again thank you saketini, i've missed you as i've been in utah, but you are always someone i come back to!

7te66xfgRefJEmsBHbqK6w.text: Been here multiple times and the food is always pretty good!  The happy hour specials are always a good deal.  From 3-6 in the afternoon happy hour kicks off with a good selection of sushi and cocktails.  It changes from 6-8 then 8-10 and then again until closing.  The staff Couvi and Matt are always great and attentive and the sushi chefs are always busy making your food!  Great food at a decent price that won't break the bank!

jFDCAkeO0xSOwP6-gv70qg.text: Super friendly service, up front and behind the sushi bar.  Tasty, fresh, well presented sushi and nigiri.  Good vibe, moderate noise, easy for conversations.

tqUzZSjwD795tG9cTLdL5A.text: A decent sushi spot for Mesa. Affordable and have some solid happy hour deals on the daily. The quality is good for the price! I always dig the bronze medal and the crazy boy. Restaurant for family or dates and bar for those who wish to partake. Satisfying and fulfilling. Environment wise I'm a fan of any place that deals decent sushi without being too pretentious. It's laid back and chill and the staff is welcoming.
